page.title: 09TRANSPORT IN CHERINGTON
page.content: The travel habits of children in the rural South Cotswolds were assessed by a questionaire of 54 children. Just over half the children came to school on foot, just under half by car and one by bus. None came by bicycle or any other transport. Asked how many times a year they travel by train, 23 replied never, 14 once, 10 twice and 7 more than twice. One-fifth of the sample had travelled by air in the last 5 years, and two-fifths by car ferry. {Vehicles owned: 0 1 2 3 More} Cars 3 31 18 1 1 Motorcycles 39 10 5 0 0 Bicycles 6 5 13 10 20 (Numbers refer to families)
